details.llm_def: The term "dhara" refers to a mountain or a holder, often used in compounds to denote bearing or containing something. It can also signify a Vasu deity, a Pāṇḍava warrior, or represent the earth. Additionally, it denotes a king of tortoises, symbolizing Vishnu’s Kurma avatar, and occasionally refers to a frivolous person.

definitions.text: one of the eight Vasus; a Vasava; father of three sons. Dravīṇa, Hutahavya and Raja; (Dravīṇa and Hutahavyavāha Vā. P.); according to M. P. he had two sons by Kalyāṇi and three by Mandharā.
